description: Cumulative counting sequence: method A (adjective-before-noun) pairs, starting with 4.
comments: Segments (as at A217760): 4; 1,4; 2,4,1,1; 3,4,3,1,1,2; ...The 4th segment is read "3 4's and 3 1's and 1 2" as a record of what was previously written; 3,3,1 are adjectives and 4 1 2 are nouns.  Conjecture: every nonnegative integer occurs. - _Clark Kimberling_ Mar 25 2013
example: Write 4, thus having 1 4, thus having 2 4's and 1 1, thus having 3 4's and 3 1's and 1 2, etc.
mathematica: s = {4}; Do[s = Flatten[{s, {Count[s, #], #} & /@ DeleteDuplicates[s]}], {14}]; s (* Peter Moses, Mar 21 2013 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_, Apr 27 2000
